pr_title: Implement API methods for Block/Fluid states and FluidType [API-8]

timeline.bodyText: It’s not intrinsic, the return types are completely different (api.FluidState vs nms.FluidState)
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: Not intrinsic either, it's an API construct, not the net.minecraft.FluidState.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText:
If this is intrinsic (which it seems like it very well is in dev time), you need to prefix with a prefix for the
@Implements(iface = ...) on the mixing itself as well.
timeline.author: gabizou

timeline.bodyText: What's this _Old? is it being retained? Is it still being applied?
timeline.author: gabizou
gabizou

replies.bodyText: I'd assume the old mixin shouldn't have a shared impl, but the way you've put it makes me think this mixin doesn't really belong here.
replies.author: i509VCB

+

+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;

+

+
+@Mixin(StateHolder.class)
+public abstract class StateHolderMixin_API<S extends State<S>, C> implements IStateHolderMixin_API<S> {

replies.bodyText: This is a case where the class needs javadocs explaining the diamonding of generic types.
replies.author: gabizou
